Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Rhomboid minor C6 & C7 SP Medial border of scapula (above scapular spine) Dorsal scapular n.
C4 - C5		 Scapula: Retraction, Downward rotation, Stabilization
``` ::: ::: # Origin {#origin} SP of C6 & C7 @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Insertion {#insertion} Medial border of scapula (*above scapular spine*) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ![Left scapula (Posterior view) @grayAnatomyHumanBody1918](/The Archive/Images/Gray anatomy 1918 images/Osteology/image203 gray1918 Left scapula. Dorsal surface.gif){#fig-gray1918-image203} # Innervation {#innervation} [Dorsal Scapular N.]({{< var ref-dorsal-scapular-nerve.path >}}) ([C4]({{< var ref-nerve-root.c4 >}}), [C5]({{< var ref-nerve-root.c5 >}})) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Action {#action} **STJ**: Retraction, Downward rotation, Stabilization @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Notes # Function The Serratus Anterior (along with the rhomboids) serves to aid in scapular stability during arm elevation @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020 ![Superior View of the shoulder: You can see how the rhomboids and SA both actively stabilize the scapulothoracic joint by pulling the scapula towards the thoracic wall @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020](/The Archive/Anatomy/Skeletal Muscles/Upper Limb Muscles/Axioappendicular Posterior Muscles/images/Dutton fig16.2 Superior aspect of shoulder.png)
